frame.name: Quitting_a_place
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Self_mover</fen> leaves an initial <fen>Source</fen> location. The <fen>Path</fen> by which the Self_mover departs, and the <fen>Intended_goal</fen> of the <fen>Direction</fen> may also be mentioned. In many words which evoke this frame, there is an additional implication that the <fen>Self_mover</fen> is discontented with the <fen>Source</fen> location.
<ex><fex name="Self_mover">I</fex> <t>left</t> <fex name="Source">San Francisco</fex> <fex name="Intended_goal">for Vancouver</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Self_mover
FE.definition: <def-root>This is the entity which moves under its own power. </def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Source</fen>. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. In particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.
</def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition: <def-root>A relation to a landmark that describes the trajectory in the midst of the motion. (It is thus neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor the <fen>Intended_goal</fen>.) </def-root>

FE.name: Intended_goal
FE.definition: <def-root>Any expression which tells where the <fen>Self_mover</fen> intends to end up as a result of the motion.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any expression which describes a property of motion which is not directly related to the trajectory of motion expresses the frame element <fen>Manner</fen>. Descriptions of steadiness, grace, means of motion, and other things count as <fen>Manner</fen> expressions. </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An event involving the <fen>Self_mover</fen> that results in the <fen>Self_mover</fen> moving in the specified way. </def-root>

FE.name: Speed
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Speed</fen> is the rate at which the <fen>Self_mover</fen> moves.</def-root>

FE.name: Co-participant
FE.definition:
<def-root>A second moving object that moves in coordination with the <fen>Self_mover</fen>.
</def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition:
<def-root>The state of the <fen>Self_mover</fen> during the action.
</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> is where the motion (which is specified by a <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen>) is located.</def-root>

FE.name: Path_shape
FE.definition: <def-root>The configuration formed by the entire <fen>Path</fen> of the <fen>Self_mover</fen>, taken simultaneously. </def-root>

FE.name: Direction
FE.definition: <def-root>The direction in which the <fen>Self_mover</fen> goes. </def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the motion takes place.
</def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The state-of-affairs that the <fen>Self_mover</fen> wishes to bring about. </def-root>

FE.name: Vehicle
FE.definition: <def-root>The device or bodypart that serves to move the <fen>Self_mover</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Duration_of_final_state
FE.definition:
<def-root>The length of time that the <fen>Self_mover</fen> spends away from the <fen>Source</fen>.
</def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition: <def-root>The state of the <fen>Self_mover</fen> at the end of the event.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition:
<def-root>A factor which explains the particular motion or manner of motion of the <fen>Self_mover</fen>.
</def-root>

FE.name: Reciprocation
FE.definition: <def-root>An event paired with the motion, which explains why the motion is expected. In particular, <fen>Reciprocation</fen> is used to indicate an action that is being rewarded or punished by the motion, and/or is paired with the motion as the other side of an agreement.</def-root>

FE.name: Containing_event
FE.definition: <def-root>An event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at the time of departure and which the departure is taken to be a part of.</def-root>

FE.name: Frequency
FE.definition: <def-root>The number of times that an action occurs in a given time.</def-root>

FE.name: Re-encoding
FE.definition: <def-root>A larger conceptualization that includes the departing as an integral part. The departure expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action in this larger conceptualization. </def-root>

FE.name: New_situation
FE.definition: <def-root>An unexpected event that affects some agent (usually the Self_mover), which is enabled by, and occurs after, the departing.</def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>The state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the departing event itself and any of its participants, and is merely peripherally related to the event as a whole.</def-root>

FE.name: Coordinated_event
FE.definition: <def-root>The label <fen>Coordinated_event</fen> is to be used for phrases denoting an event (it does not allow states) that the departing is rhythmically aligned with. (This would then further require that the departing be iterated.) The <fen>Coordinated_event</fen> is conceived of as independent: it would occur regardless of the event expressed by the target, which is not even an incidental or optional sub-part of the <fen>Coordinated_event</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Distance
FE.definition: <def-root>The distance from the <fen>Source</fen> that the <fen>Self_mover</fen> ends up.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: quit.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: leave, especially permanently

lexUnit.name: withdraw.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: depart from a place

lexUnit.name: withdrawal.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of withdrawing or retreating from a place

lexUnit.name: vamoose.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: depart hurriedly.

lexUnit.name: skedaddle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to hastily leave a job

lexUnit.name: split.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: leave, especially suddenly

lexUnit.name: vacate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: leave (a place) in which one has lived, or spent a long period of time.

lexUnit.name: sally.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make a sortie; set forth.

lexUnit.name: retreat.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: withdrawal from a difficult, exposed, or uncomfortable position

lexUnit.name: retreat.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: withdraw from a difficult, exposed, or uncomfortable situation

lexUnit.name: escapee.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: somebody that has escaped, especially from prison

lexUnit.name: emigre.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person who has left their country for political reasons

lexUnit.name: emigration.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: leaving a country to settle in another

lexUnit.name: emigrate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: leave one's own country in order to settle permanently in another.

lexUnit.name: emigrant.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a person who leaves their own country in order to settle permanently in another.

lexUnit.name: desertion.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: leaving a post of obligation in violation of oath or orders

lexUnit.name: desert.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: leave (a place)

lexUnit.name: defect.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: abandon one's country or cause in favour of an opposing one.

lexUnit.name: defection.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of abandoning a cause, disowning an allegiance

lexUnit.name: bolt.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: run away suddenly

lexUnit.name: abandon.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: desert or leave permanently
